channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @Anzovina @RabbiMarkAsherG @roripn @TheRaDR @RavMABAY Bitten by the radioactive bug of …. Talmud study!
item.source:markdown: @Anzovina @RabbiMarkAsherG @roripn @TheRaDR @RavMABAY Bitten by the radioactive bug of …. Talmud study!

item.description: @peterhimmelman As a former (NY State) Rochestarian, I have mixed feelings about this.
item.source:markdown: @peterhimmelman As a former (NY State) Rochestarian, I have mixed feelings about this.

item.description: @ErinPLeft @EladNehorai I have never heard the term. What does it mean?

item.description: @onthemainline As someone typesetting a transliterated siddur tonight, I appreciate the warning.
item.source:markdown: @onthemainline As someone typesetting a transliterated siddur tonight, I appreciate the warning.

item.description: @onthemainline But what if the whole world is a narrow trestle?
item.source:markdown: @onthemainline But what if the whole world is a narrow trestle?

item.description: @YehudaKurtzer @ZvikaKlein He frequently has one of the day’s most circulated FB post. Seems worth paying attention to what he’s up to.
item.source:markdown: @YehudaKurtzer @ZvikaKlein He frequently has one of the day’s most circulated FB post. Seems worth paying attention to what he’s up to.

item.description: And they say that Republicans never think about the Jews. https://t.co/bKuHfmj8Pj
item.source:markdown: And they say that Republicans never think about the Jews. https://t.co/bKuHfmj8Pj

item.description: @smith_randallk @scalzi @Sandhilldiary Yes. My friend graduated Yale in '86. She used the phrase sarcastically, with the clear Communist Party reference, and it was criticizing the far left from a standard liberal perspective.
item.source:markdown: @smith_randallk @scalzi @Sandhilldiary Yes. My friend graduated Yale in '86. She used the phrase sarcastically, with the clear Communist Party reference, and it was criticizing the far left from a standard liberal perspective.

item.description:
Here's the thing: the values of personal freedom and individual choice that let me decide to wear a yarmulke as an eighth grader in a public school are the same one that require me to accept people's determination of their gender and marriage partner. https://t.co/FFsxRfW7Gp

Ben is basically arguing that this time, Christian supremacy is good for the Jews. Given how little they care for the lives of Christian women with ectopic pregnancy, I have my doubts.
item.source:markdown:
Here's the thing: the values of personal freedom and individual choice that let me decide to wear a yarmulke as an eighth grader in a public school are the same one that require me to accept people's determination of their gender and marriage partner. https://t.co/FFsxRfW7Gp
Ben is basically arguing that *this* time, Christian supremacy is good for the Jews. Given how little they care for the lives of *Christian* women with ectopic pregnancy, I have my doubts.

item.description: @scalzi @Sandhilldiary I'm so old, that I remember learning the phrase "politically correct" from someone who had picked it up as a recent undergrad, before it made its breakout into the rightwing mediasphere. That is to say, during the Reagan Administration.
item.source:markdown: @scalzi @Sandhilldiary I'm so old, that I remember learning the phrase "politically correct" from someone who had picked it up as a recent undergrad, *before* it made its breakout into the rightwing mediasphere. That is to say, during the Reagan Administration.

item.description: @mordyovits @Shmarya Seems unfair. I have no doubt they’ll soon accept responsibility and resolve to do better. By holding another asifa against the internet.
item.source:markdown: @mordyovits @Shmarya Seems unfair. I have no doubt they’ll soon accept responsibility and resolve to do better. By holding another asifa against the internet.

item.description: @rmneiss A fair assumption, given their refusal to call out Republicans for party line opposition to hate crime reporting and white supremacist fighting bills they actually lobbied for in May. @ArnoRosenfeld
item.source:markdown: @rmneiss A fair assumption, given their refusal to call out Republicans for party line opposition to hate crime reporting and white supremacist fighting bills they actually lobbied for in May. @ArnoRosenfeld

item.description:
@EladNehorai They make Republicans feel good about being on Team Oligarchic Evil, and since the Times depends on Republicans and friends-of-Republicans (who do you think shops at Tiffany’s or makes ad spending decisions?) keeping Republicans happy is central to the company’s business model.

@EladNehorai And it’s not just the op ed page. https://t.co/NNdjDMDzdM
item.source:markdown:
@EladNehorai They make Republicans feel good about being on Team Oligarchic Evil, and since the Times depends on Republicans and friends-of-Republicans (who do you think shops at Tiffany’s or makes ad spending decisions?) keeping Republicans happy is central to the company’s business model.
@EladNehorai And it’s not just the op ed page. https://t.co/NNdjDMDzdM

item.description: @seanoconnor77 @Popehat I’m sure it helps that the victim’s name was Arlene Alvarez and the killer’s was Tom Earls.

item.description:
Tony Earls shot Arlene Alvarez to death and his Texas jury lets him off. The system is working as it was designed. https://t.co/KLwN2lhqg2

Perhaps related: A lot of my Jewish friends are looking in to what might be called “self-deporting.”
item.source:markdown:
Tony Earls shot Arlene Alvarez to death and his Texas jury lets him off. The system is working as it was designed. https://t.co/KLwN2lhqg2

item.description: In discussing efforts to use coercive control legislation to help agunot, @ORAAgunot said they were also hearing concern about that approach. This thread from Australia looks at the downsides. https://t.co/syNwMXjJj8
